1 About East Kalimantan

We will be analysing the East Kalimantan province project within our project. Within East Kalimantan, we will analyse the Samarinda and Balikpapan Regency/City.

North Penajam Paser:
Babulu
Penajam
Sepaku and Waru

Kutai Kartanegara:
Anggana
Loa Janan
Loa Kulu
Marang Kayu
Muara Jawa
Samboja
Sanga Sanga
Sebulu Tenaggarong
Tenggarong Seberang

2 Background
Jakarta has been the capital of Indonesia since 1949, and it’s experiencing rapid growth like no other. Given the excessive number of vehicles on congested roads, this has not only polluted the air, but also decreased the productivity of the nation as people spend a large amount of time idling in traffic.With that in mind, Indonesia is going to relocate its new capital from Jakarta to a new city in East Kalimantan, Borneo.
3 Motivation
Despite Kalimantan being four times bigger than Java, it is concerning that it accounts for less than a tenth of the gross domestic production. With Java accounting for 60% of the country’s population and more than 50% of economic activity, the shift of the country’s capital to Kalimantan is inevitable.
The beauty of the chosen Kutai Kartanegara and Penajam Paser Utara Municipality in East Kalimantan is that it (1) has a lower exposure to natural disaster (2) geographically located at the centre of Indonesia and (3) has more space than Jarkarta to create new opportunities for migrants from other parts of Indonesia. All in all, this strategic shift will address the issue of inequality and relieve the burden on Jakarta.
4 Objective
We aim to recommend a new capital city for Indonesia based on the geospatial characteristics of the location.
In this project we will be studying the following areas:
Population and Demographics
Economy
Transport and Communication
Infrastructure
Environment and Hazards
5 Data Sources
6 Scope of Work
Ashlyn Yip

Bradley Yeo Kian

Roads, Seaport and Airport Map

articles.title: Project Sepaku
articles.contents:
SMT201 GIS Project Website
Overview
Report
Poster


Home
About Us
☰




Project Sepaku






Problem:

Indonesia needs to relocate the new capital from Jakarta to a city in East Kalimantan, Borneo.



Motivation
Leverage GIS skills to analyse a large land area.
Learn Bahasa Indonesia to translate fields into English.
Integrate dirty and missing data from multiple sources.


Approach:
Raster Distance
Raster to Vector
Binary Analysis
Proximity Analysis
Accessibility to Seaports and Airports
GIS-Based Multiple-Criteria Decision Analysis
Choropleth Maps


Results
Screenshots and a working demo of the system you built.
Insert picture here


Future Work
Proportional Symbol map of high GDP growth areas after capital has been relocated.
Proportional Symbol map showing carbon emissions by region or city.
Choropleth map showing infant mortality rate as it is one of the best indicators of the livability of a city.

Further Reading
Indonesia Sets 2024 Deadline to Move Its Capital to Borneo
Jakarta Ruled Guilty of Neglecting Jakartans Right to Cleean Air
A Capital City in the Jungle





The new capital of Indonesia should be in Binuang, Sepaku
